conclusion: Line a is the relationship image of the terminal voltage U and current I of the battery under a certain light intensity.
Line b is the U-I image of a resistance R.
The graph shows the intersection of line a and line b at a specific point.
The intersection point has a voltage of 2.5V and a current of 0.2A.
The red dot where line a intersects the vertical axis represents the electromotive force E of the power source, which is 3.6V.
The red dot where the two graph lines intersect represents the operating point of the closed circuit.
At the operating point, the voltage across the resistor Ur is 2.5V and the current Ir is 0.2A.

premise: The internal resistance r is calculated using the formula r = (E - Ur) / Ir.
